001/*

005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter.MetaschemaDataTypeProvider;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.object.AmbiguousDate;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.object.AmbiguousDateTime;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.InvalidValueForCastFunctionException;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.impl.DateWithoutTimeZoneItemImpl;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type.IAtomicOrUnionType;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type.InvalidTypeMetapathException;
015import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
016
017import java.time.LocalDate;
018import java.time.ZoneOffset;
019import java.time.ZonedDateTime;
020import java.time.temporal.ChronoUnit;
021
022import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
023
024/**
025 * An atomic Metapath item representing a date value in the Metapath system with
026 * or without an explicit time zone.
027 * <p>
028 * This interface provides functionality for handling date/time values with or
029 * without time zone information, supporting parsing, casting, and comparison
030 * operations. It works in conjunction with {@link ZonedDateTime} to handle time
031 * zone ambiguity.
032 */
033public interface IDateItem extends ITemporalItem {
034  /**
035   * Get the type information for this item.
036   *
037   * @return the type information
038   */
039  @NonNull
040  static IAtomicOrUnionType<IDateItem> type() {
041    return MetaschemaDataTypeProvider.DATE.getItemType();
042  }
043
044  @Override
045  default IAtomicOrUnionType<? extends IDateItem> getType() {
046    return type();
047  }
048
049  /**
050   * Construct a new date item using the provided string {@code value}.
051   *
052   * @param value
053   *          a string representing a date
054   * @return the new item
055   */
056  @NonNull
057  static IDateItem valueOf(@NonNull String value) {
058    try {
059      return valueOf(MetaschemaDataTypeProvider.DATE.parse(value));
060    } catch (IllegalArgumentException ex) {
061      throw new InvalidTypeMetapathException(
062          null,
063          String.format("Invalid date value '%s'. %s",
064              value,
065              ex.getLocalizedMessage()),
066          ex);
067    }
068  }
069
070  /**
071   * Construct a new date item using the provided {@code value}.
072   * <p>
073   * This method handles recording if an explicit timezone was provided using the
074   * {@code hasTimeZone} parameter. The {@link AmbiguousDate#hasTimeZone()} method
075   * can be called to determine if timezone information is present.
076   *
077   * @param value
078   *          a date, without time zone information
079   * @param hasTimeZone
080   *          {@code true} if the date/time is intended to have an associated time
081   *          zone or {@code false} otherwise
082   * @return the new item
083   * @see AmbiguousDateTime for more details on timezone handling
084   */
085  @NonNull
086  static IDateItem valueOf(@NonNull ZonedDateTime value, boolean hasTimeZone) {
087    return hasTimeZone
088        ? IDateWithTimeZoneItem.valueOf(value)
089        : valueOf(new AmbiguousDate(value, false));
090  }
091
092  /**
093   * Construct a new date item using the provided {@code value}.
094   * <p>
095   * This method handles recording that the timezone is implicit.
096   *
097   * @param value
098   *          a date, without time zone information
099   * @return the new item
100   * @see AmbiguousDateTime for more details on timezone handling
101   */
102  @NonNull
103  static IDateItem valueOf(@NonNull LocalDate value) {
104    return valueOf(ObjectUtils.notNull(value.atStartOfDay(ZoneOffset.UTC)), false);
105  }
106
107  /**
108   * Construct a new date item using the provided {@code value}.
109   *
110   * @param value
111   *          an ambiguous date with time zone information already identified
112   * @return the new item
113   */
114  @NonNull
115  static IDateItem valueOf(@NonNull AmbiguousDate value) {
116    return value.hasTimeZone()
117        ? IDateWithTimeZoneItem.valueOf(value.getValue())
118        : new DateWithoutTimeZoneItemImpl(value);
119  }
120
121  /**
122   * Cast the provided type to this item type.
123   *
124   * @param item
125   *          the item to cast
126   * @return the original item if it is already this type, otherwise a new item
127   *         cast to this type
128   * @throws InvalidValueForCastFunctionException
129   *           if the provided {@code item} cannot be cast to this type
130   */
131  @NonNull
132  static IDateItem cast(@NonNull IAnyAtomicItem item) {
133    IDateItem retval;
134    if (item instanceof IDateItem) {
135      retval = (IDateItem) item;
136    } else if (item instanceof IDateTimeItem) {
137      IDateTimeItem dateTime = (IDateTimeItem) item;
138      // get the time at midnight
139      ZonedDateTime zdt = ObjectUtils.notNull(dateTime.asZonedDateTime().truncatedTo(ChronoUnit.DAYS));
140      // pass on the timezone ambiguity
141      retval = valueOf(zdt, dateTime.hasTimezone());
142    } else if (item instanceof IStringItem || item instanceof IUntypedAtomicItem) {
143      try {
144        retval = valueOf(item.asString());
145      } catch (IllegalStateException | InvalidTypeMetapathException ex) {
146        // asString can throw IllegalStateException exception
147        throw new InvalidValueForCastFunctionException(ex);
148      }
149    } else {
150      throw new InvalidValueForCastFunctionException(
151          String.format("unsupported item type '%s'", item.getClass().getName()));
152    }
153    return retval;
154  }
155
156  @Override
157  default IDateItem castAsType(IAnyAtomicItem item) {
158    return cast(item);
159  }
160
161  @Override
162  default int compareTo(IAnyAtomicItem item) {
163    return compareTo(cast(item));
164  }
165}
